displayName: "Rebels and Revels: Part Two" - Pivotal Fragment

parameters: \pop[5]The Monarch wakes up with a splitting headache.
They were knocked out cold, and one of the last to awaken.
Klace was already up, ready to hear what the both of you had missed.
\pop[5]Everyone is led into the prison cell.
Klace still lays unconscious, having been knocked out.
\pop[3]Did you have somewhere else to be?
\pop[2]Dante gestures broadly at the fact that we're in a prison cell.
\pop[4]There's always somewhere I need to be.
It's the "getting there" part that comes with mixed results.
\pop[3]And where do you have to be right now?
\pop[4]Think I could break those bars open?
\pop[3]Still have time for bickering, I see.
\pop[3]Aren't there more important matters at hand?
We should get them up to speed.
We should get you up to speed.
\pop[4]I'm guessing the fake deal didn't go so well.
But I hope it bought you some time.
\pop[3]I think we got all we needed.
\pop[5]Isaac holds up a piece of paper.
You pick up a few skills, being a swindler.
\pop[3]They're planning to take down the Mazeo Shipping Company.
If they damage the economy, they can easily take advantage of the chaos.
\pop[3]Well, they have some dirt on us.
Mainly the fact that we work with former pirates.
\pop[4]You think that'd matter. But it doesn't.
If the people catch wind of this, they could doubt us.
We don't just \c[14]work\c[0] with them. They're \c[14]essential\c[0] to our success.
\pop[4]And not just ours, but Mazeo's as a whole.
Their sailing mastery, their effective trade routes...
There was a reason we pardoned them and put them to work.
\pop[2]It's true. During the war, we formed a treaty with pirates.
\pop[2]We'd pardon them of their crimes, and integrate them into society.
\pop[2]They were good people, and would strengthen Mazeo's core industry. Trade.
\pop[4]It could also put a target on the pirate's heads.
Former pirates, I guess - but still.
We have to do our best to protect them.
\pop[3]This is all we need to take down The Thorns...!
\pop[3]Yeah. We just need to escape, first.
Then we can gather our forces and attack.
\pop[4]Wait. It might not need to come to that.
\pop[4]We only want to bring in their leader, right?
If we assault their base to do it, then innocents could die.
\pop[4]Sometimes people do bad things in the name of survival.
I was one of those people, don't you remember?
\pop[4]It was only because there were circumstances \c[14]outside\c[0] of my control.
In my heart, I know I'm a good guy. But I did what I had to do...
\pop[4]I'm \c[14]certain\c[0] there's a few people like me in The Thorns.
Do they deserve to die just because this is their only option?
\pop[4]We could probably even make use of their skill.
Legitimize them, like we did with the pirates.
\pop[3]Let's not get ahead of ourselves, here.
There's not much we can do behind bars.
\pop[4]We should make some noise and get the guards here.
I'll see if I can arrange a meeting with their leader.
I can show them this paper and demand their surrender.
They're planning irreparable damage to Mazean society.
\pop[4]And what's worse, it's damage that they can profit from.
They don't care who gets hurt as long as they win.
\pop[4]How do you plan on arranging a meeting?
\pop[4]I'll tell them who I am. What I've done.
I can let my reputation speak for itself.
\pop[3]Maybe you can find out if there's any moles in our ranks?
All that information they had on us? There \c[14]must\c[0] be.
\pop[4]Yeah. We'll bring in their leader, and learn about their operation.
We can deliver true justice, \c[14]and\c[0] take down The Thorns.
\pop[4]We'll give their leader a little lesson in mercy...
